text: Disruption of the human <extra_id_0> SCL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> locus by " illegitimate " V - ( D ) - J recombinase activity .

A fusion complementary DNA in the T cell line HSB-2 elucidates a provocative mechanism for the disruption of the putative hematopoietic transcription factor <extra_id_0> SCL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The fusion cDNA results from an interstitial deletion between a previously unknown locus , SIL ( <extra_id_0> SCL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> interrupting locus ) , and the 5 ' untranslated region of <extra_id_0> SCL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Similar to 1 ; 14 translocations , this deletion disrupts the <extra_id_0> SCL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 5 ' regulatory region .
This event is probably mediated by V - ( D ) - J recombinase activity , although neither locus is an immunoglobulin or a T cell receptor .
Two other T cell lines , CEM and RPMI 8402 , have essentially identical deletions .
Thus , in lymphocytes , growth - affecting genes other than immune receptors risk rearrangements .
